intro: Pentanema propinquum, commonly known as the small-flowered pentanema, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the family Onagraceae, which includes willows and evening primroses. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in its native habitat.
